knowledge.question: What allows Bob to enter 'www.example.com' into his browser instead of 8.8.8.8 to view a website?
explanation: Correct: A DNS server contains a database of public IP addresses and their associated hostnames, and in most cases serves to resolve, or translate, those names to IP addresses as requested.
Incorrect: ARP Server will map a dynamic Internet Protocol address (IP address) to a permanent physical machine address in a local area network (LAN)/].
Incorrect: A TCP Server will only handle the TCP communication protocol.
Incorrect: A DHCP server assigns IP addresses to its clients based on a preconfigured pool of IPs.
